intro: Spathicalyx, commonly known as the orchid vine, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and the presence of showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically features long, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and can be found in various colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Spathicalyx is native to tropical regions and thrives in humid, warm climates.
